natural problem: Find the remainder when $x^4 + 1$ is divided by $x^2 - 3x + 5.$
natural solution: The long division is shown below. \[ \begin{array}{c|cc ccc} \multicolumn{2}{r}{x^2} & +3x & +4 \\ \cline{2-6} x^2 - 3x + 5 & x^4 & & & & +1 \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{x^4} & -3x^3 & +5x^2 \\ \cline{2-4} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & +3x^3 & -5x^2 & \\

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 4 + 1"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 - 3 * x + 5"
and h2 : "P x mod Q x = R x"
shows  "R x = -3 * x - 19"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the remainder when $x^4 + 1$ is divided by $x^2 - 3x + 5.$ The final Answer is -3x - 19
 ### Proof
 The long division is shown below. \[ \begin{array}{c|cc ccc} \multicolumn{2}{r}{x^2} & +3x & +4 \\ \cline{2-6} x^2 - 3x + 5 & x^4 & & & & +1 \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{x^4} & -3x^3 & +5x^2 \\ \cline{2-4} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & +3x^3 & -5x^2 & \\
 \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & +3x^3 & -9x^2 & +15x \\ \cline{3-5} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & +4x^2 & -15x & +1 \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{} &  & +4x^2 & -12x & +20 \\ \cline{4-6} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} &  &  & -3x & -19 \\
 \end{array} \]Thus, the remainder is $\boxed{-3x - 19}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 4 + 1"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 - 3 * x + 5"
and h2 : "P x mod Q x = R x"
shows  "R x = -3 * x - 19"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the remainder when $x^4 + 1$ is divided by $x^2 - 3x + 5$. Denote this remainder as $R(x)$. The final answer is $R(x) = -3x - 19$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 4 + 1"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 - 3*x + 5"
and h2 : "P x dvd Q x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x = Q x * R x + (-3*x - 19)"
shows  "R x = -3*x - 19"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the remainder when $x^4 + 1$ is divided by $x^2 - 3x + 5.$ The final Answer is -3x - 19
 ### Proof
 The long division is shown below. \[ \begin{array}{c|cc ccc} \multicolumn{2}{r}{x^2} & +3x & +4 \\ \cline{2-6} x^2 - 3x + 5 & x^4 & & & & +1 \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{x^4} & -3x^3 & +5x^2 \\ \cline{2-4} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & +3x^3 & -5x^2 & \\
 \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & +3x^3 & -9x^2 & +15x \\ \cline{3-5} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & +4x^2 & -15x & +1 \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{} &  & +4x^2 & -12x & +20 \\ \cline{4-6} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} &  &  & -3x & -19 \\
 \end{array} \]Thus, the remainder is $\boxed{-3x - 19}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 4 + 1"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 - 3*x + 5"
and h2 : "P x dvd Q x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x = Q x * R x + (-3*x - 19)"
shows  "R x = -3*x - 19"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Given that $P(x) = x^4 + 1$ and $Q(x) = x^2 - 3x + 5$. If $P(x)$ divides $Q(x)$ and for all $x$, $P(x) = Q(x) \cdot R(x) - 3x - 19$. Find $R(x)$. The final answer is $R(x) = -3x - 19$.
